docs.lead_paragraph: You have questions; we have answers. Mostly.

headline.main: How the Health Care Law Affects Your Business

docs.abstract: Answers to questions from small-business owners about how the provisions of the act will affect them.
docs.snippet: Answers to questions from small-business owners about how the provisions of the act will affect them.

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.
docs.abstract: Insurance companies change their stance on covering children with pre-existing conditions, the latest on the student loan overhaul and other consumer-focused items from Wednesday's Times.
docs.snippet: Insurance companies change their stance on covering children with pre-existing conditions, the latest on the student loan overhaul and other consumer-focused items from Wednesday's Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama is expected to announced an expansive new offshore drilling policy Wednesday in a speech at the Andrews Naval Air Facility.

headline.main: The Early Word: Drill, Obama, Drill

docs.abstract: President Obama proposes expanding offshore drilling, while international officials mull a plan to rebuild Haiti.
docs.snippet: President Obama proposes expanding offshore drilling, while international officials mull a plan to rebuild Haiti.

headline.main: The Bill Is Passed, but Debate Goes On
headline.print_headline: The Bill Is Passed, but Debate Goes On

docs.lead_paragraph: The governor and Republicans in the legislature threatened the Democratic attorney general, Thurbert Baker, after he rejected a challenge to the federal health care act.

headline.print_headline: Georgia Attorney General Spurns Suit on Health Care

docs.lead_paragraph: Under pressure from the White House, insurance companies said they would cover children with pre-existing conditions.

headline.seo: Insurers to Cover Children’s Pre-existing Health Conditions
headline.main: Insurers to Comply With Rules on Children
headline.print_headline: Insurers to Cover Children’s Pre-existing Health Conditions

docs.snippet: Under pressure from the White House, insurance companies said they would cover children with pre-existing conditions.

docs.lead_paragraph: After voting on the landmark and contentious health care legislation, members of Congress are back in their home districts facing, as my colleague Adam Nagourney put it, "a bewildering crosscurrent of political forces." In fact, the health care vote is dominating political campaigns across the country, and not just for those running for Congress. Here's a sampling:

headline.main: BlogTalk: All (Health Care) Politics Is Local

docs.abstract: How the health care legislation is trumping other issues in political races across the country.
docs.snippet: How the health care legislation is trumping other issues in political races across the country.

docs.lead_paragraph: Under pressure from the White House, health insurance companies said on Tuesday they would comply with rules to be issued soon by the Obama administration requiring them to cover children with pre-existing medical problems.

headline.main: Insurers to Comply With New Rules on Children

docs.abstract: Under pressure from the White House, insurers said on Tuesday that they would comply with new rules requiring them to cover children with pre-existing conditions.
docs.snippet: Under pressure from the White House, insurers said on Tuesday that they would comply with new rules requiring them to cover children with pre-existing conditions.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama signed the budget reconciliation bill containing a package of revisions to the big health care legislation after giving a speech at Northern Virginia Community College, a setting aimed at drawing attention to the education component of the bill.
docs.abstract: In Alexandria, Va., President Obama signed into law the final piece of the Democrats' health care overhaul.
docs.snippet: In Alexandria, Va., President Obama signed into law the final piece of the Democrats' health care overhaul.

docs.lead_paragraph: My colleague Denise Grady has an article today about provisions in the new health law prohibiting health insurance discrimination by sex, meaning that women will no longer be charged a higher premium simply because as a group they often consume more medical services than men.

headline.main: Lowering the Health Costs of Womanhood (and Then Manhood)

docs.abstract: The portion of the health care law prohibiting gender discrimination in insurance premiums actually helps, and hurts, both sexes, but at different points in their lives.
docs.snippet: The portion of the health care law prohibiting gender discrimination in insurance premiums actually helps, and hurts, both sexes, but at different points in their lives.
